title: Cowal Way Walking Route

images.title: Alan O'Dowd / Cowal Way marker post above the Donich Water
images.caption: Cowal Way marker post above the Donich Water

images.title: Stan Campbell / Beinn Lochain and the Cowal Way
images.caption: A scenic view of Beinn Lochain and the Cowal Way. This image shows a scenic stretch of the Cowal Way (Walk from Portavadie to Inveruglas or Ardgartan) a tour of the highlands in miniature. This picture was taken from Carnach Mor.

images.title: Mark Nightingale / Cairn on Cowal Way
images.caption: This cairn close to the saddle between Cnoc Coinnich and The Brack is adorned with a fencepost daubed with white paint to indicate the route of an indistinct path which forms part of the trail.

images.title: John Ferguson / Deargbruaigh Cottage
images.caption: Deargbruaigh Cottage. Cottage situated on the trail near Portavadie.

images.title: Richard Webb / Strondavon
images.caption: Strondavon. A house beneath the forest in Glendaruel. View across the Garvie Burn from a very icy farm track also used as the Cowal Way.

images.title: Richard Webb / Bealach an Lochain
images.caption: Bealach an Lochain. Pass between Beinn Lochain and Carnach Mòr linking Lochgoilhead and Strachur. The pass is now promoted as part of the trail. Beinn Lochain in shadow.

images.title: Richard Webb / Forest road, Strath nan Lùb
images.caption: Snowy scene on the forest road, Strath nan Lùb. Sign of occasional use on the forest road between Glen Branter and Glendaruel.

description: This stunning walk starts at Portavadie on the banks of Loch Fyne and heads to Inveruglas. The route passes the Kyles of Bute, Loch Ruel and Tighnabruaich before joining the River Ruel for a riverside stretch. You then pass Loch Goil, Arrochar and Loch Long before finishing on west shore of Loch Lomond at Inverugla.
